intro: Gilia karenae, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. This species is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in rocky habitats and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Gilia karenae plays an important role in pollination and is a symbol of the biodiversity found in the Sierra Nevada region.
